alert.note: Alert for Deuel; Grant; Marshall; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 6:20PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...LOCALIZED BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW TO CONTINUE TONIGHT... Locally strong and gusty winds will continue along the eastern slopes of the Sisseton Hills tonight, especially south of Watertown exit 177 on Interstate 29. South to southwest winds of 15 to 30 mph with occasional gusts over 35 mph are likely. Locations that could be affected include the higher terrain areas of the Sisseton Hills as well as up to 15 miles east of the hills. This includes Interstate 29 between Summit and Peever, or between mile markers 210 and 225. U.S. Highway 12 from Summit to Milbank may also experience strong winds, as well as roadways across much of Deuel County. The strong winds will promote blowing and drifting snow, along with low visibility at times. Anyone with travel plans across far northeast South Dakota should be prepared for inclement weather and are urged to slow down and allow for extra distance between vehicles if need be, especially along I-29 between Peever and the exit for Estelline and Toronto. Downslope winds are forecast to diminish by early Wednesday morning.
